oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) transmission from a persistently infected goat to pregnant goats and calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Passler, T.
Riddell, K. P.
Edmondson, M. A.
Galik, P. K.
Zhang, Y.
Walz, P. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine viral diarrhea virus
BVDV
goats
persistently infected
transmission
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Infections with bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) occur in various artiodactyls. Persistent infections occur in non-bovine species, but rarely in goats. Recently, a persistently infected (PI) goat was born following experimental infection of pregnant goats. The present study evaluated the potential of BVDV transmission from the PI goat to pregnant goats and calves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2014; 175-176
